hook.text: Your CPU can process data in a nanosecond. Your hard drive takes millions of nanoseconds to respond.

buildup.text: Computers use a hierarchy: registers, cache, RAM, SSD, hard drive â€” each level slower but larger.

discovery.text: CPU cache holds the most-used data. Accessing cache is 100 times faster than accessing RAM.

twist.text: Cache is tiny â€” often just megabytes. The art is predicting which data you'll need next.

climax.text: The illusion of speed comes from keeping the right data in the right level at the right time.

punchline.text: Speed is about where data lives, not just how fast you process.
